discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Interactions provide a centralized location for all communication channels in the platform. Each interaction represents a request for assistance through a given channel, for example, a call or a chat.

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-servicenow-platform/page/administer/interaction/concept/interaction-management.html

Selected Answer: D
D is correct.

https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/vancouver-servicenow-platform/page/administer/interaction/concept/interaction-management.html#:~:text=Interactions%20provide%20a%20centralized%20location,a%20call%20or%20a%20chat.

choices.D: A request for assistance made through a chat, phone call, or walk-up
choices.B: A record that a Customer Service Agent uses to identify and resolve a question or an issue for an external customer
choices.C: A binding agreement between two parties
choices.A: Any configuration item that has been made accessible to customers

questions.question_text: In ServiceNow’s CSM Application, what is an interaction?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
Customer
[sn_customerservice.customer]

Customer role for researching questions, issues, or problems. Customers can create cases and view and edit existing cases for themselves. They can also view a list of assets belonging to their accounts.

Selected Answer: AC
AC is Correct

https://support.servicenow.com/kb?id=kb_article_view&sysparm_article=KB0639072

Selected Answer: AC
Answer:
 A. Can research questions issues, or problems, and create view and edit cases for only their own accounts
 C. Can view assets belonging to their account

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/sandiego-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/concept/customer-access-mgmt.html

questions.question_text: Which services does a Customer (sn_customerservice.customer) have access to? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Can edit information or roles for existing contacts
choices.C: Can view assets belonging to their account
choices.B: Can assign the roles to other contacts in the same account
choices.A: Can research questions issues, or problems, and create view and edit cases for only their own accounts

questions.question_text: To which recipient types can targeted communications (publications) be sent? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
Create recipients lists for active publications.

The list of recipients for an article can include internal users, accounts, contacts, and consumers. When an article is published, the recipients on this list can view the article on the Customer or Consumer Service Portal. Recipients can also receive optional email notifications.

Selected Answer: BC
BC is Correct.

https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/vancouver-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/concept/c_TargetedCommunications.html

Correct answer is AC
To enable support organizations to efficiently manage customer cases, both agents and customers need to have a common understanding of the products and services being used. For those same support organizations to efficiently manage customer cases, agents need the ability to:
• Trace information provided in a case to the right product or service to which it relates.
• See the detailed configurations detailed configurations of the products and services deployed for a customer to determine the action needed.

Selected Answer: AC
AC is correct

AC is correct

AC is correct

questions.question_text: What does viewing a customer’s install base enable customer service agents to do? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
Employees with the proxy contact role can do the following:
Create cases on behalf of customers by email, phone, chat, Virtual Agent, and from the Customer Service Portal.
Create requests on behalf of customers from the Customer Service Portal.

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/utah-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/concept/employee-create-case-for-customer.html

Selected Answer: BD
Answer: 
 B. Create cases on behalf of customers
 D. Create requests on behalf of customers

Explanation: "The proxy contact role enables employees to create cases for customer accounts and contacts. Employees can also be proxy case contacts on behalf of customers." which includes
 - Create cases on behalf of customers by email, phone, chat, Virtual Agent, and from the Customer Service Portal. (b.)
 - Create requests on behalf of customers from the Customer Service Portal. (d.)

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/utah-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/concept/employee-create-case-for-customer.html

Selected Answer: BD
BD is Correct..
Employees with the proxy contact role can do the following:
Create cases on behalf of customers by email, phone, chat, Virtual Agent, and from the Customer Service Portal.
Create requests on behalf of customers from the Customer Service Portal.

questions.question_text: Users with the sn_customerservice.proxy_contact role can do which of the following? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Create cases on behalf of customers
choices.D: Create requests on behalf of customers
choices.E: Manage major incident communication on behalf of a customer service manager
choices.A: Manage cases on behalf of customer service agents
choices.C: Manage requests on behalf of customer service agents
